comment.author: 65134654@N03
comment._content: Long before my time, it's cool to see how things where. Also can make a few urban outings a bit more interesting seeing these photos from what was everyday for previous generations, I wonder what they'll make of our iPods, games and all the other stuff :D

comment.author: 63163769@N00
comment._content: I thought that the Station looked a little lonely, so I added some people. I hope the folks from Belfast don't mind being in Kilkenny.

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: What kind of locomotive is that?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66151649@N02] All we have is that it was no. C205. Unsure whether "lifting trains" had specific locomotives pulling them...

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: Excellent one of the old Kilkenny station. The lifting train was engaged in removing the track on the old Portlaoise-Kilkenny line which had closed the previous year.

comment.author: 75752622@N07
comment._content:
Fantastic picture, just wondering if anyone had any outside pictures of the station in its days as a through station to Portlaoise as I have never been able to find any pictures of it before bridge was demolished?
Good that other relics and reminders of the branch has survived such as vaulted bridge and a couple of telegraph poles nearby where the bridge from station used to continue on to beside the site of a former Gas works.

Many thanks

Steve

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/75752622@N07] Will keep an eye out in our collections, but maybe [http://www.flickr.com/photos/flyingsnail] will know of others...

comment.author: 7200003@N08
comment._content: i think that image is of the train coming over the old bridge which was later demolished (the remains can be seen as you are passing through the traffic lights from Johns Street towards Hebron Road direction).

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/32428096@N05] So it's one of these, en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CIE_201_Class. Thanks for the info!

comment.author: 13713567@N06
comment._content: Lifting the Portlaoise - Kilkenny line, sadly lifting trains were common in the 1960s with the closing of many lines. C class locos worked a lot of lifting trains. Great photo.
